issue.title: spring_stiffness and spring_reference are killed by model editor

content.raw:
The model editor parses protobuf messages to generate the inspectors. Unfortunately, there are several inconsistencies between [joint axis SDF](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=joint#joint_axis) and [joint axis msgs](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9559e9655bdaadf4ebd627305713963f871bb0f8/gazebo/msgs/axis.proto?fileviewer=file-view-default), so some fields are lost in the process. 

I think that an ideal fix would sync the SDF and protobuf descriptions.
content.html:
The model editor parses protobuf messages to generate the inspectors. Unfortunately, there are several inconsistencies between joint axis SDF and joint axis msgs, so some fields are lost in the process.

I think that an ideal fix would sync the SDF and protobuf descriptions.

issue.title: spring_stiffness and spring_reference are killed by model editor

content.raw: A temporary fix could involve keeping the original SDF fields and only updating the fields which match protobuf.
content.html: A temporary fix could involve keeping the original SDF fields and only updating the fields which match protobuf.

issue.title: spring_stiffness and spring_reference are killed by model editor

content.raw: Ok interesting. I think we need both. Only updating fields the message understands means you don't have to deal with this every single time you update the SDF spec
content.html: Ok interesting. I think we need both. Only updating fields the message understands means you don't have to deal with this every single time you update the SDF spec

issue.title: spring_stiffness and spring_reference are killed by model editor

content.raw:
You're right. But ideally, the model editor should let you do everything you can do with SDF. Keeping original fields prevents breaking existing models, but unfortunately it isn't very transparent to the user. 

I think we should probably try to enforce keeping protobuf and SDF in sync. This probably applies to other places besides the model editor.
content.html:
You're right. But ideally, the model editor should let you do everything you can do with SDF. Keeping original fields prevents breaking existing models, but unfortunately it isn't very transparent to the user.

I think we should probably try to enforce keeping protobuf and SDF in sync. This probably applies to other places besides the model editor.

issue.title: spring_stiffness and spring_reference are killed by model editor

content.raw:
True... I don't know enough to say how that would be done. My gut reaction is to say "just pick one".
Either only define these things in the SDF spec and generate message from that, or only define them in the msgs and generate the SDF spec from that. Not sure which of those is easier or more useful, but that's just my initial reaction.
content.html: True... I don't know enough to say how that would be done. My gut reaction is to say "just pick one". Either only define these things in the SDF spec and generate message from that, or only define them in the msgs and generate the SDF spec from that. Not sure which of those is easier or more useful, but that's just my initial reaction.
